name: vscode-ltex
description: LanguageTool grammar checking with LaTeX support
author: Julian Valentin

ltex.enabled.markdownDescription: Controls whether the extension is enabled. Allows to disable LanguageTool on specific workspaces.

ltex.language.markdownDescription: The language (e.g., `en-US`) LanguageTool should check against. For supported languages see the [list of languages at LanguageTool.org](https://languagetool.org/languages/). Requires the installation of a [language support extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/search?term=ltex&target=VSCode). Use a specific variant like `en-US` or `de-DE` instead of the generic language code like `en` or `de` to obtain spelling corrections (in addition to grammar corrections).

ltex.commands.ignore.markdownDescription: List of additional L<sup>A</sup>T<sub>E</sub>X commands to be ignored by the L<sup>A</sup>T<sub>E</sub>X parser, listed together with empty arguments.

ltex.commands.dummy.markdownDescription: List of additional L<sup>A</sup>T<sub>E</sub>X commands to replace by dummy words, listed together with empty arguments.
